abstract.text: An object that defines a data source for an audio input or output, giving information such as the source’s name, location, and orientation.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: You obtain data source descriptions from the shared

objects corresponding to its input and output ports. Only built-in microphone ports on certain devices support the location, orientation, and polar pattern properties. If a port doesn’t support these features, the value of its

This class is especially useful for differentiating between microphone configurations on devices having more than one built-in microphone. Such devices may also support signal processing features for spatial filtering, or
, in which the system makes the device more sensitive to audio signals from a particular direction. See

abstract.text: Play, record, and process audio; configure your app’s system audio behavior.
An object that communicates to the system how you intend to use audio in your app.
Constants that describe the location of the data source on device.
Constants that indicate the directions in which a data source can point, relative to the device’s natural orientation.
Constants that describe the possible polar patterns of the data source on an iOS device.
The currently selected output data source.
An array of available output data sources for the current audio route.
Temporarily changes the current audio route.
Sets the output data source for an audio session.
An object that defines a data source for an audio input or output, giving information such as the source’s name, location, and orientation.
The system-assigned identifier for the data source.
A human-readable name for the data source.
The location of the data source on the device.
The orientation of the data source relative to the device’s natural orientation.
The preferred directivity configuration for the data source.
The data source’s active polar pattern.
Selects the preferred directivity configuration for the data source.
The set of directivity configurations supported by the data source.
Information about the capabilities of the port and the hardware channels it supports.
The available data sources for the port.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
